alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 01 at 2:41AM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches except between 5 and 10 inches above 7500 feet possible. Areas below canyons in the Albuquerque Metro area may only see 1 to 3 inches of snow. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, South Central Highlands, South Central Mountains, Eastern Lincoln County, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitterly cold low temperatures are also expected Wednesday night with lows in the single digits. However, wind chills will be even colder.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County
